summary: study aims to evaluate attitudes of consumers and live-poultry workers toward the policy. the live-poultry workers consisted of two sub-groups: live-poultry traders and poultry farm workers. the study reveals a substantial refusal or slowness to accept the policy. policy acceptability among live-poultry workers diverges within the two sub-groups. drop in trading and insufficient subsidy hamper acceptance by live-poultry traders.
